perturbation.original_text: Oceanic Time Warner Cable will include the following disclaimer on the Watchit Content: "The materials shown are for entertainment purposes only and does not provide any guarantees of winning or improving your odds of winning on this program. The rules of the games as shown may not apply to all properties and may change from time to time."
perturbation.changed_text: Oceanic Time Warner Cable will include the following disclaimer on the Watchit Content within their internal documentation: "The materials shown are for entertainment purposes only and does not provide any guarantees of winning or improving your odds of winning on this program. The rules of the games as shown may not apply to all properties and may change from time to time."
perturbation.explanation: Moving the disclaimer requirement to 'internal documentation' makes it less likely to be displayed to viewers, weakening consumer protection against misleading claims. This placement obscures the disclaimer from the audience it is intended to protect, reducing its effectiveness and potentially leading to legal issues regarding false advertising or misleading content.
perturbation.contradicted_law: False Advertising Laws (United States, variations by state)

perturbation.original_text: In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000) per month multiplied by the number of months remain on the agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that Oceanic Time Warner Cable removes the above content and or terminates this agreement prior to December 31, 2006, Oceanic Time Warner Cable agrees to pay a cancellation fee; however, the exact amount will be determined at the discretion of Watchit Media based on future revenue projections.
perturbation.explanation: The change introduces ambiguity and contradicts the original clause's clear financial penalty by replacing the fixed cancellation fee with a discretionary amount based on 'future revenue projections.' This shift favors Watchit Media but removes the certainty for Oceanic Time Warner Cable, making the financial penalty potentially open to dispute and less enforceable. The lack of a defined amount constitutes a structural flaw affecting enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Requirement for Definite Terms
